question: [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Function: parse_ed25519_signature()] [Address substitution] Can the override_address mechanism at line 124 be exploited to attribute signatures to wrong addresses, causing incorrect transaction history and potential fund loss tracking? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Function: parse_multi_signature()] [Signer confusion] Does the override_address parameter at line 150 properly override the sender address in multi-signature scenarios, or can this cause confusion between actual signer and recorded signer? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Function: standardize_address()] [Address normalization] Can differences in address standardization between indexer and consensus nodes cause signature records to reference non-existent addresses, breaking historical transaction queries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Function: parse_multi_agent_signature()] [Secondary signer mismatch] At line 212, can an attacker provide mismatched secondary_signer_addresses and secondary_signers arrays to confuse which address actually signed the transaction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Function: parse_fee_payer_signature()] [Fee payer impersonation] Can the fee_payer_address override at line 257 be manipulated to incorrectly attribute fee payment to different addresses, hiding the actual transaction sponsor? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Function: parse_multi_agent_signature()] [Primary sender confusion] Does the is_sender_primary flag at line 196 correctly distinguish between sender and secondary signers, or can this be manipulated to elevate secondary signer privileges? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Function: parse_fee_payer_signature()] [Fee payer ordering] Why is the fee payer assigned multi_agent_index of (secondary_signer_addresses.len() + 1) at line 256—could off-by-one errors cause index collision with actual signers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Function: parse_fee_payer_signature()] [is_sender_primary confusion] At line 255, why is the fee payer marked as is_sender_primary: true when it's not the actual transaction sender—could this cause authorization confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Function: parse_multi_agent_signature()] [Vector append safety] Do the .append() operations at lines 191, 205 properly handle memory allocation failures when processing transactions with hundreds of secondary signers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Function: parse_fee_payer_signature()] [Signature ordering] Does the order of signature appending (sender → secondary signers → fee payer) at lines 226-258 match consensus validation order, or could ordering mismatches cause validation failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Function: get_signature_type()] [Type confusion] Can the string-based type discrimination at lines 100-113 be exploited if new signature types are added without updating this function, causing incorrect signature categorization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Function: from_user_transaction()] [Missing signature types] Does the match statement at lines 52-97 exhaustively cover all possible APITransactionSignature variants, or can new variants cause panics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Function: parse_multi_agent_signature_helper()] [Account signature coverage] Does the match at lines 271-328 handle all APIAccountSignature variants correctly, or can unhandled types cause signature data loss? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Function: from_user_transaction()] [NoAccountSignature handling] Why does APITransactionSignature::NoAccountSignature at line 96 return an empty vector—could this hide transactions that should have signatures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Struct: Signature] [Type string validation] Are the type_ strings at lines 130, 164, 346, 371, 396, 421 validated against a fixed set of allowed values, or can arbitrary strings cause database corruption? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Struct: Signature] [Composite key collision] Can the composite primary key (transaction_version, multi_agent_index, multi_sig_index, is_sender_primary) at lines 23-27 have collisions when processing complex multi-signature transactions with many signers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Struct: Signature] [Primary key uniqueness] Does the is_sender_primary boolean in the primary key at line 27 properly prevent collisions between sender and non-sender signatures with same indices? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Struct: Signature] [Foreign key integrity] Can the transaction_version foreign key at line 22 reference transactions that don't exist in the transactions table, causing referential integrity violations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Struct: Signature] [Index overflow in key] If multi_agent_index or multi_sig_index exceed database integer column limits, can this cause insertion failures that halt the indexer? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Struct: Signature] [Negative index values] Are negative values for multi_agent_index or multi_sig_index at lines 32-33 properly validated, or can they cause unexpected database behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Struct: Signature] [JSON injection] Can the public_key_indices field at line 41 stored as serde_json::Value be exploited for JSON injection attacks when queried from the database? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Function: parse_multi_signature()] [JSON serialization DoS] Can an attacker craft public_key_indices arrays with millions of elements causing the JSON serialization at lines 168-175 to consume excessive memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Struct: Signature] [Empty JSON array] Do all non-multi signature types correctly initialize public_key_indices to empty array at lines 133, 349, 374, 399, 424, or can null values cause database constraints violations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Function: parse_multi_signature()] [JSON array validation] Does the serde_json::Value::Array construction at line 168 validate that all indices are valid positive integers, preventing malformed JSON storage? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/signatures.rs] [Struct: Signature] [String length limits] Are the public_key and signature string fields at lines 38-39 bounded in length, or can extremely long values cause database storage overflow? (Medium)
